verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.comment: Standard introductory formula for divine speech.

verses.text: Speak to the Israelites and say to them, 'When you come into the land that I am giving you as your dwelling place,
verses.comment: This verse begins instructions regarding offerings upon entering Canaan.

verses.text: and you wish to present a fire offering to the LORD—a burnt offering or a sacrifice, to fulfill a vow, or as a freewill offering, or at your appointed festivals—to make a pleasing aroma to the LORD, from the herd or from the flock,
verses.comment: Lists the different types of offerings.

verses.text: then he who presents his offering to the LORD shall bring also a grain offering: one-tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with one-fourth of a hin of oil.
verses.comment: Hebrew measurements used; an ephah is about 22 liters, a hin is about 3.7 liters.

verses.text: And you shall prepare with the burnt offering or with the sacrifice one-fourth of a hin of wine as a drink offering, for each lamb.
verses.comment: Drink offering details matching grain offering amounts.

verses.text: Or for a ram, you shall prepare as a grain offering two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with one-third of a hin of oil;
verses.comment: Increase in amounts reflects the larger animal.

verses.text: and as a drink offering, you shall offer one-third of a hin of wine, as a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
verses.comment: Drink offering is proportional to the animal.

verses.text: And when you prepare a bull as a burnt offering or a sacrifice, to fulfill a vow or as a peace offering to the LORD,
verses.comment: Bull offerings require larger portions.

verses.text: then with the bull you shall bring as a grain offering three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with half a hin of oil;
verses.comment: Three-tenths of an ephah is a larger grain offering.

verses.text: and as a drink offering you shall offer half a hin of wine, as a fire offering, a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
verses.comment: The amounts are set for each type of animal.

verses.text: This is what shall be offered for each bull, or for each ram, or for each lamb or young goat.
verses.comment: Standardization of offerings.

verses.text: As many as you prepare, so shall you do for each one, according to their number.
verses.comment: Consistent procedure regardless of quantity.

verses.text: All native Israelites shall do these things in this way, in presenting a fire offering, a pleasing aroma to the LORD.
verses.comment: Applies to all native Israelites.

verses.text: If a foreigner lives with you, or whoever is among you throughout your generations, and wishes to present a fire offering, a pleasing aroma to the LORD, he shall do as you do.
verses.comment: Gentile sojourners are held to the same standard.

verses.text: For the assembly, there shall be one statute for both you and the foreigner who lives with you, a perpetual statute throughout your generations. As you are, so shall the foreigner be before the LORD.
verses.comment: Equality in law for Israelite and foreigner.

verses.text: One law and one regulation shall apply to you and to the foreigner who lives with you.'
verses.comment: Emphasis on unified worship practice.

verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.comment: Another section beginning.

verses.text: Speak to the Israelites and say to them, 'When you come into the land to which I am bringing you,
verses.comment: Parallel language to earlier verse, beginning new instruction.

verses.text: then when you eat the bread from the land, you shall offer up a contribution to the LORD.
verses.comment: First-fruits offering detailed.

verses.text: Of the first of your dough you shall present a loaf as a contribution; as you do with the contribution from the threshing floor, so you shall offer it.
verses.comment: The 'dough' offering is a new contribution.

verses.text: From the first of your dough you shall give to the LORD a contribution throughout your generations.
verses.comment: Mandates this practice for all generations.

verses.text: But if you unintentionally fail to observe all these commandments that the LORD has spoken to Moses—
verses.comment: Introduces the concept of unintentional sin.

verses.text: everything that the LORD has commanded you by Moses, from the day the LORD gave commandment and onward through your generations—
verses.comment: Includes all law from Moses onward.

verses.text: then if it was done unintentionally without the congregation's knowledge, all the congregation shall offer one young bull as a burnt offering, as a pleasing aroma to the LORD, with its grain offering and drink offering, according to the regulation, and one male goat as a sin offering.
verses.comment: Corporate sin offering detailed.

verses.text: The priest shall make atonement for all the congregation of Israel, and they shall be forgiven, because it was unintentional; and they have brought their offering, a fire offering to the LORD, and their sin offering before the LORD for their unintentional sin.
verses.comment: Atonement through priestly mediation.

verses.text: And all the congregation of Israel shall be forgiven, and the foreigner who lives among them, because all the people had done it unintentionally.
verses.comment: Forgiveness extends to sojourners.

verses.text: If any one person sins unintentionally, he shall bring a female goat a year old as a sin offering.
verses.comment: Individual unintentional sin offering.

verses.text: And the priest shall make atonement before the LORD for the person who sinned unintentionally, and he shall be forgiven.
verses.comment: Forgiveness follows priestly atonement.

verses.text: You shall have one law for both him who does anything unintentionally, whether he is a native Israelite or a foreigner who lives among you.
verses.comment: Once again, the law applies to native and foreigner.

verses.text: But the person who does anything defiantly, whether he is native or foreigner, that one blasphemes the LORD; he shall be cut off from among his people.
verses.comment: 'Defiantly' or 'with a high hand' means knowingly rejecting God's command.

verses.text: Because he has despised the word of the LORD and has broken his commandment, that person shall be completely cut off; his guilt shall remain on him.'
verses.comment: Deliberate sin is not atoned and results in exclusion.

verses.text: While the Israelites were in the wilderness, they found a man gathering wood on the Sabbath day.
verses.comment: Narrative episode about Sabbath violation.

verses.text: Those who found him gathering wood brought him to Moses and Aaron and to all the congregation.
verses.comment: Legal procedure following a violation.

verses.text: They put him in custody, because it had not been made clear what should be done to him.
verses.comment: Precedent for seeking divine guidance on law.

verses.text: The LORD said to Moses, 'That man shall surely be put to death; all the congregation shall stone him with stones outside the camp.'
verses.comment: Capital punishment for flagrant Sabbath violation.

verses.text: So all the congregation took him outside the camp and stoned him to death, as the LORD had commanded Moses.
verses.comment: Obedience to divine command in judgment.

verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying:
verses.comment: Another section begins.

verses.text: Speak to the Israelites, and tell them to make tassels on the corners of their garments throughout their generations, and to put a blue cord on the tassel of each corner.
verses.comment: Commandment about tzitzit (tassels) for reminders.

verses.text: And it shall be a tassel for you to look at, so you may remember all the commandments of the LORD and do them, and not follow after your own heart and your own eyes, going astray.
verses.comment: Tassels function as physical reminders of God’s law.

verses.text: So you shall remember and do all my commandments, and be holy to your God.
verses.comment: Purpose: holiness resulting from obedience.

verses.text: I am the LORD your God who brought you out of the land of Egypt to be your God. I am the LORD your God.'
verses.comment: Echoes phrases from the Exodus and the Ten Commandments.
